Quote: In immunoelectron micrographs the antigen is associated with the microneme/rhoptry complexes of the sporozoite.

In Theileria-infected lymphocytes, 24–48 h following transfection, MR-imaging revealed that cells co-transfected with H2B-GFP and pcDNA3 (empty vector control) strong green fluorescence was distributed diffusely throughout the cell nucleus indicating a ‘normal’ (non-apoptotic) chromatin organization (Fig. 1A; plus movie S1A).
Comments: human H2B is transfected, not Theileria

Localisation: surface during schizont, not during merogeny
Quote: gp34 is expressed at the surface of the schizont. … gp34 expression is downregulated during merogony
the mAbs anti-PIM and 1C12 were used as markers for the parasite surface;
In BoMac cells, recombinant TP03_0882 was readily detected, localising predominantly to the nucleus of the transfected cell.
